posts.title: Fausto
posts.excerpt: On the Oaxacan coast of Mexico, rumblings of previous times are never far from the surface. Tales of shapeshifting, telepathy and dealings with the Devil are embedded in the colonization and enslavement of the Americas. Characters from the Faust legend mingle with the inhabitants, while attempting to colonize and control nature through a seemingly never-ending …

posts._title: Laurent Achard – Le dernier des fous AKA The Last of the Crazy People (2006)
posts.title: Le dernier des fous
posts.excerpt: Based on the 1967 novel by Canadian author Timothy Findley, THE LAST OF THE CRAZY PEOPLE is a French naturalist drama from director Laurent Achard. Martin is a young boy growing up in a family on the brink of collapse, the story is presented from his perspective as he passively watches it slowly crumble around …
posts.titleEnglish: The Last of the Crazy People

posts._title: Slobodan D. Pesic – Slucaj Harms AKA The Harms Case (1987)
posts.title: Slucaj Harms
posts.excerpt: Quote:Harms Case, The / Slučaj Harms [FL 555]The film is based on the life and writing of Russian avant-garde poet of the 1920s Danilo Ivanovič Harms who has become a cult figure in Yugoslavia. Harms wrote about strange and absurd cases, only to became a “case” himself when he was persecuted by the Soviet authorities. …

posts.title: Destino: Estambul 68
posts.excerpt: Destino: Estambul 68 is a Spanish-Italian crime film first released in 1967, directed by Miguel Iglesias.

posts.title: À l’ombre
posts.excerpt: A mother who has recently been incarcerated refuses to give up on her young son, no matter how fragile their connection may now be.

posts._title: Bill Melendez – A Charlie Brown Christmas (1965) (HD)
posts.title: A Charlie Brown Christmas (1965)
posts.excerpt: SynopsisOne of the most endearing of all Peanuts’ specials finds Charlie Brown nurturing the thinnest, scraggliest Christmas tree ever. posts.title: Datai
posts.excerpt: IMDB says:A gynecologist attempts to rid the world of sexual problems by separating sex on the one hand and reproduction, which he feels should be left to artificial wombs.

posts._title: João César Monteiro – Recordações da Casa Amarela AKA Recollections of the Yellow House (1989)
posts.title: Recordações da Casa Amarela
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:This quirky Portuguese comedy won a silver lion at the 1989 Venice Film Festival. The story concerns the irrepressible Joao de Deus (played by the director, Joao Cesar Monteiro), an ill-kempt, lusty and none-too-honest resident of Violeta’s boarding house, which happens to have yellow walls. Joao, who has no visible means of support, is in …

posts._title: Various – Ponts de Sarajevo AKA Bridges of Sarajevo (2014)
posts.title: Ponts de Sarajevo
posts.excerpt: 13 European directors explore the theme of Sarajevo and what this city represents in European history over the past hundred years, and what Sarajevo incarnates today in Europe. From different generations and origins, these eminent filmmakers offer many singular styles and visions. François Schuiten, famous Belgian comic book artist (Cities of the Fantastic) imagined animated …

posts.title: Le Système Zsygmondy
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:In order to climb a peak, two young walkers arrive at the Zsygmondy mountain refuge the night before. But the girls find there’s only one single place left…
